intro: Coccoloba savannarum, commonly known as the Florida hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in wetland areas and along the edges of water bodies. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces showy, hibiscus-like flowers in shades of red, pink, or white. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to saline and brackish environments. The plant plays an important role in supporting local wildlife and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
